result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 28, 2022 at 08:15 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
10:10 AM Defendant Lucas M Knutowski in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Molly M Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jessica A Klein appeared by zoom video for Lucas M Knutowski as a friend of the Court.  Attorney Klein states the defendant has a revocation hearing set for October 25, 2022.  The Court will adjourn this matter for a week for status of counsel.  Court directs Attorney Klein to contact the Public Defenders office to have the defendant evaluated so she may potentially be appointed on this case.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Court informs attorney Klein if she is appointed she may appear by zoom for the next date.
Hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Lucas M Knutowski
Current: Waukesha Co Jail, 515 W Moreland Blvd, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 10-04-2022)
Prior: 445 Madison St, Waukesha, WI 53188

Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. Comply with all licensing restrictions. Defendant has Atty. Jessica Klien for his revocation hearing.  Obey all community supervision rules.

8:58 AM Defendant Lucas M Knutowski in court, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Peter Tempelis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
